alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:46AM EDT until May 04 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Essex, and Morris Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Passaic River Above Singac. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EDT Thursday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river level will continue to slowly fall today. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 08/24/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 8.7 Thu 7 am 7.4 6.8 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 400 PM EDT.
